,,,Christopher Chapman,,Read all documentation provided for the project and get a firm understanding of what is expected of you.,http://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/42590809
42590579,Visual Frameworks,research,1,"
column14:
Determine which visual framework you intent to use for the duration of the project.

Make certain to experiment and play around with multiple frameworks until you find one that suits your needs.

Get a working knowledge with the code you may be working with so that you choose one that is flexible enough to fit your project."

42589605,[1.2] Initialization Iteration,"
column82:
This style guide will set the tone for all views. If / when later on in the project a new view is needed to be created you can reuse predesigned elements to achieve the desired look for the view without having to go through the wireframe process, speeding your development time.

Please use the resources linked below for further explanation. These assets you create should be placed into an ASSETS folder in your Github Repo.

http://styletil.es/"

Identify the unique elements from your Style Tiles and develop the markup to create those items as needed through your views."

column122:
Review your code, designs, and other materials created to ensure they are commented, well formatted, and developed to a a standard that represents your personal best work.

You will be handing off your project to other developers for review and you should be confident that your work will stand up to their scrutiny in addition to the rubric."
